muhammad-ibn-musa-al-khwarizmi.title: Muhammad Ibn Musa Al Khwarizmi
muhammad-ibn-musa-al-khwarizmi.summary: Muhammad Ibn Musa Al Khwarizmi invents algorithms for solving linear equations. The words 'algorithm and algebra are derived from his Latin name, Algoritmi

pierre-de-fermat.title: Pierre de Fermat
pierre-de-fermat.summary: Pierre de Fermat scribbles his last theorem in the margins of a book.  It is later discovered and immediately declared to be the most difficult math problem of all time.

leibniz.title: Gottried Wilhelm Leibniz
leibniz.summary: Invents Calculus and the calculator, both frustrating and delighting math majors everywhere.

lovelace.title: Ada Lovelace
lovelace.summary: Ada Lovelace writes the first computer program on punch cards, a nested for-loop to calculate Bernoulli numbers

hilbert.title: David Hilbert
hilbert.summary: David Hilbert asks a great question.  This questions becomes known as the Entsheidungsproblem

turing.title: Alan Turing
turing.summary: Alan Turing invents the computer before it's invented

church.title: Alonzo Church
church.summary: Church invents Lambda Calculus, the mathematical foundation for functional programming

curry.title: Haskell Curry
curry.summary: Describes the first "high level" computer language and invents a thing called the "Y Combinator"

neumann.title: John Von Neumann
neumann.summary: Neumann creates the basic architecture for modern computers

kleene.title: Stephen Kleene
kleene.summary: Neumann creates the basic architecture for modern computers

fortran.title: Fortran
fortran.summary: Fortran is the first high level computer language

mccarthy.title: Lisp
mccarthy.summary: John McCarthy invents Lisp, the first functional programming language

strachey.title: Christopher Strachey
strachey.summary: Coins the terms "currying" and "first class citizen"

backus.title: John Backus
backus.summary: John Backus publishes "Can Programming be Liberated from the Von Neumann Style?"

visicalc.title: Visicalc
visicalc.summary: Visicalc, the first spread-sheet, is releases

codd.title: E.F. Codd
codd.summary: E.F. Codd invents relational databases and SQL

hudak.title: Paul Hudak
hudak.summary: Paul Hudak releases the Haskell Report, to announce a new and totally useless programming language.

moggi.title: Eugenio Moggi
moggi.summary: Eugenio Moggi presents his lecture "Notions of Computation and Monads"

wiles.title: Sir Andrew Wiles
wiles.summary: Sir Andrew Wiles proves Fermat's Last Theorem, 358 years after it was discovered.

eich.summary: Brendan Eich writes the first version of JavaScript in 10 days.
